definition: cannot bear to/disturbed
(negative prefix)/not/no
to bear/to endure/to tolerate/to restrain oneself
spectacle too horrible to endure (idiom); tragic sight/appalling scenes of devastation
can't bear to
(idiom) great plans can be ruined by just a touch of impatience
pinyin: xiao3 bu4 ren3 ze2 luan4 da4 mou2

definition: lit. the eye cannot bear to see it (idiom); a scene too pitiful to behold
too horrible to endure (idiom); tragic spectacle/appalling scenes of devastation
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom)
lit. the eye cannot bear to see it (idiom); a scene too pitiful to behold

sentences.english: These luxury candles are too good to burn. D. L. & Co.
sentences.chinese: 這些奢侈至極的蠟燭實在不忍將其點燃。

sentences.english: I can't bear to use harsh words against people.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我的心太軟，所以我不忍心對人惡言相向。
聖誕節當前，我真的不忍心啊。

sentences.english: What is your opinion about David who gave up the chances to kill Saul?
sentences.chinese: 大衛有機會殺害掃羅卻不忍下手，你對此有何看法？

sentences.english: I could not tear myself away from the novel.
sentences.chinese: 這本小說讓我不忍釋手。

sentences.english: Models know their feet are in for a tough time during the shows.
sentences.chinese: 模特們都知道展示會期間他們的腳慘不忍睹。

sentences.english: We could see only his face because of his injuries.
sentences.chinese: 我只能看着他的臉，他身上的傷慘不忍睹。

sentences.english: Little could not bear the chaos great plans, students, our study not also the case?
sentences.chinese: 小不忍則亂大謀，同學們，我們的學習不也是如此嗎？

sentences.english: The construction of mending the sky had not finished yet, but people did not want to wake Nuwa up.
sentences.chinese: 人們不忍心叫醒女媧，但是補天的工作還沒有完成。
上個月就更是慘不忍睹了。

sentences.english: You have many boyfriends while I never give a fuck.
sentences.chinese: 你有很多男朋友，然而我卻從來不忍干涉。

sentences.english: Indeed it was because I could not bear its frightened appearance, as if it were an innocent person going to the place of death, that therefore I changed it for a sheep.
sentences.chinese: 即不忍其觳觫，若無罪而就死地，故以羊易之也。

sentences.english: Luxun obviously would not like to push her into such a situation.
sentences.chinese: 魯迅顯然是不忍把朱安推到這樣一個境地的。

sentences.english: I cant step on the spider without releasing the baby spiders, so I went inside to get a glass jar to trap it.
sentences.chinese: 我不忍心把它們都踩死，就去找玻璃瓶想把它裝起來。

sentences.english: It was not his will to destroy you.
sentences.chinese: 那次耶和華也應允我，不忍將你滅絕。

sentences.english: The once, seem to be miserable, eventually internecine.
sentences.chinese: 那個曾經，似乎慘不忍睹，最終兩敗俱傷。

definition: can't bear to
to take pity on/to feel tenderness toward
to lament
compassion/empathetic
to have the heart to do sth/to steel oneself to a task
to feel compassion for/to pity on/to feel sorry for
sad/wretched/miserable
mournful
distressed
to feel guilty/to feel ashamed of oneself/to be remorseful
reluctant to part with (sth or sb)/unwilling to let go of
to feel distressed about sth/heartache/cardiac pain
remorseful/guilt-ridden
depressed/dispirited/dejected
mournful
devastation/miserable condition
